Value Pairs Page (3D Graph Properties Dialog Box)

Requires: Full Development System (Windows)

Use this page of the 3D Graph Properties dialog box to configure the value pairs on the 3D graph. Each value pair consists of a numeric value and corresponding string label.

This page includes the following components:

  • Value Pairs Table—Lists the index, name, and value of the value pairs you want to display on the 3D graph.
  • Add—Adds an index, name, and value to the list.
  • Delete—Deletes a value pair from the list.
  • Name—Specifies the name of the value pair.
  • Value—Sets the value of the value pair.
  • Axis—Sets the scale you want to configure. You can select from the following options:
    • X—Selects the x-axis for configuration.
    • Y—Selects the y-axis for configuration.
    • Z—Selects the z-axis for configuration.
  • Labels—Specifies how value pairs appear on the 3D graph. You can select from the following options:
    • Value—Displays the value of the value pair.
    • None—The value pairs appear on the graph without a label.
    • Name—Displays the name of the value pair.
  • Show grid lines—Displays grid lines for each value pair. The grid line appears on the graph at the corresponding value.
  • Show ticks—Displays tick marks on the 3D graph for the value pairs you configure. Select an axis from the Axis pull-down menu to show tick marks on a specific axis.
